title: Why Boris Johnson’s Reversal of Fortune Was So Swift
sub_head: Lockdown scandals and an embrace of big government leave Conservatives with little reason to back him.
body:
While the U.K. celebrated the 70th anniversary of Queen Elizabeth II’s accession to the throne, the longest reign in the nation’s history, Boris Johnson was battling to avoid becoming her second-shortest-serving prime minister.
The fickleness of British politics is legendary. Tenure at the top of the greasy pole can be as slippery and unstable as the ascent—and the slide down is quick and painful.
